greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle whose n-th row contains the least set (ordered lexicographically) of n distinct positive integers whose geometric mean is an integer.
comment: The n-th row has the form {1,2,...,n-1,x}, where x is as small as possible.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1485 (rows 1 to 54, flattened)
mathematica: MapAt[{First@ #, 4 Last@ #} &, Array[Append[Range[# - 1], Apply[Times, Prime@ Range@ PrimePi[# - 1]]^#/(# - 1)!] &, 11], 2] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 05 2018 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 20 2003
ext: More terms using A080509 from _Michel Marcus_, Nov 04 2018
